00095 char *Util::cloneString(const char *s) {
00096   char *copy = NULL;
00097   if(s == NULL)
00098     return NULL;
00099 
00100   size_t length = strlen(s);
00101   //  copy = new ( sizeof(char) * (length+1) );
00102   copy = new char[length + 1];
00103   // strncpy is deprecated
00104   // strncpy(copy, s, length+1);
00105   memcpy(copy,s,length+1);
00106   return copy;
00107 }
00108 
00109 bool
00110 Util::stringEndsWith(const std::string& str,const std::string& end)
00111 {
00112   std::string::const_reverse_iterator s_i=str.rbegin();
00113   std::string::const_reverse_iterator s_end=str.rend();
00114   std::string::const_reverse_iterator e_i=end.rbegin();
00115   std::string::const_reverse_iterator e_end=end.rend();
00116 
00117   // see if the whole thing end is there.
00118   while (e_i!=e_end) {
00119     if ((s_i==s_end) ||   // ran out of input string
00120         ((*e_i)!=(*s_i)) // mismatch
00121         ) {
00122       return false; // didnt end with 'end'.
00123     }
00124     // advance (backwards!)
00125     e_i++;
00126     s_i++;
00127   }
00128   // 'end' was at the end of the string.
00129   return true;
00130 }

00138 void Util::mustOpenToWrite(std::ofstream &out, const char *fileName) {
00139   assert(fileName);
00140   out.open(fileName);
00141   if(!out.is_open() || !out.good()) {
00142     Err::errAbort("Couldn't open file: " + string(fileName) + " to write.");
00143   }
00144   // Set to throw an exception if something bad happens rather than silently fail.
00145   out.exceptions(ofstream::eofbit | ofstream::failbit | ofstream::badbit );
00146 }

00152 void Util::carefulClose(std::ofstream &out) {
00153   // If file is open, do some checks to make sure that it was successful...
00154   if(out.is_open()) {
00155     if(out.bad()) {
00156       Err::errAbort("Util::carefulClose() - ofstream bad.");
00157     }
00158   }
00159   out.close();
00160 }

00168   if(out.is_open()) {
00169     if(out.bad()) {
00170       Err::errAbort("Util::carefulClose() - ofstream bad.");
00171     }

00180 bool Util::fileReadable(const char *fileName) {
00181   int f;
00182   f = POSIX_OPEN(fileName, O_RDONLY);
00183   if(f < 0) 
00184     return false;
00185   POSIX_CLOSE(f);
00186   return true;
00187 }

00194 bool Util::fileCopy(const char *in, const char *out) {
00196   bool result = true;
00197 
00198   std::ifstream is (in,ios::binary);
00199   std::ofstream os (out,ios::binary);
00200   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
00201       result = false;
00202 
00203   os << is.rdbuf();
00204   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
00205       result = false;
00206 
00207   is.close();
00208   os.close();
00209   if(!is.good() || !os.good())
00210       result = false;
00211 
00212   return true;
00213 }

00220 void Util::chompLastIfSep(std::string &s) {
00221         string::size_type i = s.rfind(PATH_SEPARATOR);
00222         if(i != string::npos && i == s.length() -1)
00223                 s.erase(i);
00224 }
00225 
00226 #ifdef WIN32
00227 // Windows doesn't seem to have these defined, so we'll define them 
00228 // here for utility. Note that with the windows _stat() function all
00229 // users have id 0 and group 0.
00230 #ifndef __MINGW32__
00231 #define S_IRUSR 00400 //owner has read permission
00232 #define  S_IWUSR 00200 //owner has write permission
00233 #define S_IXUSR 00100 
00234 #endif
00235 #define S_IRWXG 00070 //mask for group permissions
00236 #define  S_IRGRP 00040 //group has read permission
00237 #define  S_IWGRP 00020 //group has write permission
00238 #define S_IXGRP 00010 //group has execute permission
00239 #define  S_IRWXO 00007 //mask for permissions for others (not in group)
00240 #define  S_IROTH 00004 //others have read permission
00241 #define S_IWOTH 00002 //others have write permisson
00242 #define S_IXOTH 00001 // others have execute permission
00243 #endif
00244 
00248 bool Util::directoryReadable(const char *dirName) {
00249   string dirString(dirName);
00250   chompLastIfSep(dirString); // Windows doesn't like the trailing '\'
00251   struct stat s;
00252   int val = 0;
00253 #ifdef WIN32
00254   int group = 0;
00255   int user = 0;
00256 #else
00257   gid_t group = getgid();
00258   uid_t user = getuid();
00259 #endif
00260   bool readable = false;
00261   val = stat( dirString.c_str() , &s);
00262   /* if it doesn't exist or isn't readable, can't read it. */
00263   if(!S_ISDIR(s.st_mode) || val != 0) {
00264     return false;
00265   }
00266   /* If user owns directory and user readable then we can read it. */
00267   if(user == s.st_uid) {
00268     readable = (S_IRUSR & s.st_mode) && (S_IXUSR & s.st_mode);
00269   }
00270   /* if group owns directory and it is user readable then we can read it. */
00271   else if(group == s.st_gid) {
00272     readable = (S_IRGRP & s.st_mode) && (S_IXGRP & s.st_mode);
00273   }
00274   /* if anybody can read directory then we can too. */
00275   else if((S_IROTH & s.st_mode) && (S_IXOTH & s.st_mode)) {
00276     readable = true;
00277   }
00278   return readable;
00279 }
00280 
00285 bool Util::directoryWritable(const char* dirname) {
00286   std::string dirname_tmp;
00287   struct stat s;
00288   bool writable = false;
00289 
00290 #ifdef WIN32
00291   int group = 0;
00292   int user = 0;
00293 #else
00294   gid_t group = getgid();
00295   uid_t user = getuid();
00296 #endif
00297 
00298   // we dont want the trailing slash.
00299   dirname_tmp=dirname;
00300   chompLastIfSep(dirname_tmp);
00301 
00302   int rv = stat(dirname_tmp.c_str(), &s);
00303 
00304   /* Cant write if not found. */
00305   if (rv!=0) {
00306     return false;
00307   }
00308   /* If it isn't a directory we can't write to it... */
00309   if (!S_ISDIR(s.st_mode)) {
00310     return false;
00311   }
00312   /* If user owns directory and user writeable then we can write it. */
00313   if (user == s.st_uid) {  
00314           writable = (S_IWUSR & s.st_mode) && (S_IXUSR & s.st_mode);
00315   }
00316   /* if group owns directory and it is user writeable then we can write it. */
00317   else if (group == s.st_gid) {
00318     writable = (S_IWGRP & s.st_mode) && (S_IXGRP & s.st_mode);
00319   }
00320   /* if anybody can write directory then we can too. */
00321   else if((S_IWOTH & s.st_mode) && (S_IXOTH & s.st_mode)) {
00322           writable = true;
00323   }
00324   //
00325   return writable;
00326 }
00327 
00335 bool Util::makeDir(const char *dirName) {
00336   int error;
00337 #ifdef WIN32
00338   error = POSIX_MKDIR(dirName);
00339 #else
00340   error = POSIX_MKDIR(dirName, 0777);
00341 #endif
00342   if(error != 0 && errno == EEXIST) 
00343     return false;
00344   else if(error != 0) 
00345     Err::errAbort("Error: Util::makeDir() - failed to make directory " + ToStr(dirName));
00346   return true;
00347 }

00350 
00360 std::string* Util::createDir(const char *dirName) {
00361 #ifdef WIN32
00362   // Windows: use ISO C++ conformants; POSIX functions are deprecated.
00363   struct _stat outDirStat;
00364   const int statError = _stat (dirName, &outDirStat);
00365 #else
00366   struct stat outDirStat;
00367   const int statError = stat (dirName, &outDirStat);
00368 #endif
00369 
00370   // Error return from fstat - requested output directory
00371   // doesn't exist, so we create one.
00372   string* msg = 0;
00373   if (statError != 0) {
00374   #ifdef WIN32
00375     // Windows: use ISO C++ _mkdir; umask is deprecated.
00376     const int mkdirError = _mkdir (dirName);
00377   #else
00378     const mode_t Umask = umask (0);
00379 
00380     // Set directory execute permissions based on current umask.
00381     mode_t Mode = S_IRWXU;      // User (this code) can read, write, execute.
00382     Mode |= (~Umask & (S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IROTH | S_IWOTH));
00383     if (Mode & (S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP)) // Group, other access is optional.
00384       Mode |= S_IXGRP;
00385     if (Mode & (S_IROTH | S_IWOTH))
00386       Mode |= S_IXOTH;
00387     const int mkdirError = POSIX_MKDIR (dirName, Mode);
00388 
00389     // Restore caller's umask.
00390     umask (Umask);
00391   #endif
00392     if (mkdirError != 0) {
00393       // Report error.
00394       msg = new string ("Unable to create directory " + string (dirName));
00395       return msg;
00396     }
00397   } // end if (statError != 0)
00398 
00399 #ifndef WIN32
00400   // Requested file exists - just check if it's a directory.
00401   else if (! S_ISDIR (outDirStat.st_mode) ) {
00402     // Report error.
00403     msg = new string ("Requested output directory " + string (dirName) + " is not a directory");
00404     return msg;
00405   }
00406 #endif
00407   // No error found.
00408   return 0;
00409 }
00410 
00418 void Util::chopString(const std::string &s, char delim, std::vector<std::string> &words) {
00419   string::size_type len = 0, start = 0, next = 0;
00420   words.clear();
00421   len = s.length();
00422   while(start < len) {
00423 
00424     next = s.find(delim, start);
00425     if(next == string::npos) {
00426       next = s.size(); // entire string.
00427     }
00428     words.push_back(s.substr(start, next - start));
00429     start = next+1;
00430   }
00431 }
00432 
00439 string Util::fileRoot(const std::string &s) {
00440   if(s.empty()) 
00441     return s;
00442   string::size_type pos = 0;
00443   string name;
00444   pos = s.rfind(PATH_SEPARATOR);
00445 #ifdef WIN32
00446   // accept the unix path separator on windows for cygwin and sanity.
00447   string::size_type unixPos = s.rfind("/");
00448   if(unixPos != string::npos) {
00449     pos = unixPos;
00450   }
00451 #endif
00452   if(pos != string::npos)
00453     name = s.substr(pos+1);
00454   else 
00455     name = s;
00456   return name;
00457 }
00458 
00475 int Util::matrixDifferences(const char *targetFile, const char *queryFile, 
00476                       int colSkip, int rowSkip, double epsilon, bool printMismatch,
00477                       bool matchRows) {
00478   vector< vector<double> > qMatrix, tMatrix;
00479   unsigned int rowIx = 0, colIx = 0;
00480   unsigned int numCol = 0, numRow = 0;
00481   bool same = true;
00482   map<string, int> qMatrixMap;
00483   vector<string> qMatrixRows, tMatrixRows;
00484   unsigned int diffCount = 0;
00485   unsigned int rowDiffCount = 0;
00486   double maxDiff = 0;
00487   Verbose::out(2, "Reading in file: " + ToStr(targetFile));
00488   RowFile::matrixFromFile(targetFile, qMatrix, rowSkip, colSkip);
00489   Verbose::out(2, "Reading in file: " + ToStr(queryFile));
00490   RowFile::matrixFromFile(queryFile, tMatrix, rowSkip, colSkip);
00491 
00492   /* If we are matching by rows grab the first column from each file
00493      and assume it is the unique row names. Create a map from the 
00494      names to the indexes for qMatrix */
00495   if(matchRows) {
00496     colIx = 0;
00497     Verbose::out(2, "Reading in rownames.");
00498     TableFile::columnFromFile(targetFile, qMatrixRows, colIx, rowSkip, true);
00499     TableFile::columnFromFile(queryFile, tMatrixRows, colIx, rowSkip, true);
00500     for(rowIx = 0; rowIx < qMatrixRows.size(); rowIx++) {
00501       if(qMatrixMap.find(qMatrixRows[rowIx]) != qMatrixMap.end()) {
00502         Err::errAbort("Duplicate row names: " + qMatrixRows[rowIx] + " in matrix 1");
00503       }
00504       qMatrixMap[qMatrixRows[rowIx]] = rowIx;
00505     }
00506   }
00507   
00508   Verbose::out(2,"Looking for differences.");
00509   if((!matchRows && qMatrix.size() != tMatrix.size()) || qMatrix[0].size() != tMatrix[0].size()) {
00510     Err::errAbort("Matrices are different sizes, not comparable.");
00511   }
00512   numRow = tMatrix.size();
00513   numCol = tMatrix[0].size();
00514 
00515   for(rowIx = 0; rowIx < numRow; rowIx++) {
00516     bool rowDiff = false;
00517     for(colIx = 0; colIx < numCol; colIx++) {
00518       int qMatRowIx = rowIx;
00519       /* If doing match rows, look up the correct row based on row name. */
00520       if(matchRows) {
00521         if(qMatrixMap.find(tMatrixRows[rowIx]) == qMatrixMap.end() )
00522           Err::errAbort("Can't find rowname: " + tMatrixRows[rowIx] + " in matrix 1");
00523         else 
00524           qMatRowIx = qMatrixMap[tMatrixRows[rowIx]];
00525       }
00526       double val = qMatrix[qMatRowIx][colIx] - tMatrix[rowIx][colIx];
00527       maxDiff = max(maxDiff, fabs(val));
00528       bool failed = (fabs(val) > epsilon);
00529       bool okFinite = true;
00530       okFinite &= isFinite(qMatrix[qMatRowIx][colIx]);
00531       okFinite &= isFinite(tMatrix[rowIx][colIx]);
00532       if(!okFinite) 
00533         Verbose::out(1, "Non-finite floating point numbers at row: " + ToStr(rowIx) + " column: " + ToStr(colIx));
00534       if(failed || !okFinite) {
00535         same = false;
00536         rowDiff = true;
00537         diffCount++;
00538         if(printMismatch) {
00539           Verbose::out(1, "row: " + ToStr(rowIx) + " col: " + ToStr(colIx) + " (" +
00540                        ToStr(qMatrix[qMatRowIx][colIx]) + " vs. " + ToStr( tMatrix[rowIx][colIx]) + ")" + " Diff: " + ToStr(val));
00541         }
00542       }
00543     }
00544     if(rowDiff)
00545       rowDiffCount++;
00546   }
00547   if(maxDiff > 0) {
00548     Verbose::out(2, "Max difference is: " + ToStr(maxDiff));
00549   }
00550   if(same) 
00551     Verbose::out(2,"Same.");
00552   else {
00553     unsigned int total = numRow * numCol;
00554     float percent = (float) rowDiffCount / numRow * 100;
00555     Verbose::out(2, "Different in " + ToStr(rowDiffCount) + " of " + ToStr(numRow) + " ( " + ToStr(percent) + "% )  entries.");
00556     percent = (float) diffCount / total * 100;
00557     Verbose::out(2, "Different at " + ToStr(diffCount) + " of " + ToStr(total) + " ( " + ToStr(percent) + "% )  entries.");
00558   }
00559   return diffCount;
00560 }
00561 
00562 
00572 std::string Util::getPathName(const char *path) {
00573   std::string s(path);
00574   if(s.find(':') != std::string::npos)
00575     Err::errAbort("Can't convert " + ToStr(path) + " as it contains a ':' character");
00576   // 92 is the ascii code for '\'
00577 #if defined (WIN32)
00578   subChar(s, '/', 92);
00579 #else
00580   subChar(s, 92, '/');
00581 #endif
00582   return s;
00583 }
00584 
00589 int32_t Util::schrageRandom(int32_t *ix) {
00590   int32_t a = 16807, p = 2147483647, xhi = 0, xlo = 0;
00591   int32_t rand = 0;
00592   int32_t r = p % a;
00593   int32_t q = p / a;
00594   Err::check(*ix > 0, "Error: Util::schrageRandom() - Cannot seed with 0");
00595   /* Break into high and low bits to avoid overflow. */
00596   xhi = (*ix) / q;
00597   xlo = (*ix)  - xhi*q;
00598   /* Combine high and low. */
00599   (*ix) = a * xlo - r * xhi;
00600   if((*ix) < 0) {
00601     (*ix) = (*ix) + p;
00602   }
00603   rand = (*ix); 
00604   return rand;
00605 }

00608 #ifdef WIN32 
00609 #define memInfo_defined 1
00616 bool memInfo_win32(uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total,
00617                    uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail)
00618 {
00619   MEMORYSTATUSEX statex;
00620   statex.dwLength = sizeof(statex);
00621   if(GlobalMemoryStatusEx(&statex) == 0) {
00622     Err::errAbort("Util::memInfo() - Could not determine memory usage with: GlobalMemoryStatusEx().");
00623   }
00624   free = statex.ullAvailPhys;
00625   total = statex.ullTotalPhys;
00626   swapAvail = statex.ullAvailVirtual - statex.ullAvailPhys;
00627   memAvail = (uint64_t)(free * 0.90);
00628 
00629   return true;
00630 }
00631 #endif
00632   
00633 #ifdef __linux__
00634 #define memInfo_defined 1
00635 
00643 bool memInfo_linux(std::string proc_meminfo_filename,
00644                    uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total,
00645                    uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail)
00646 {
00647   std::ifstream proc_meminfo;
00648   std::string key;
00649   std::string line;
00650   //char line_buf[1024];
00651   //std::istringstream line_stm(line_buf,sizeof(line_buf));
00652   uint64_t val;
00653   std::string units;
00654   uint64_t buffersUsed=0, cached=0;
00655   
00656   free=total=swapAvail=memAvail=0;
00657 
00658   // 2.4
00659   // total: used: free: shared: buffers: cached:
00660   // Mem:  4097478656 2765283328 1332195328 0 219951104 2328576000
00661   // Swap: 3224301568        0 3224301568
00662 
00663   // 2.6
00664   // MemTotal:      4059404 kB
00665   // MemFree:       2169240 kB
00666   // Buffers:         33776 kB
00667   // Cached:        1618328 kB
00668 
00669   proc_meminfo.open(proc_meminfo_filename.c_str());
00670   while (!proc_meminfo.eof()) {
00671     getline(proc_meminfo,line);
00672     //cout<<"L: "<<line<<"\n";
00673     std::istringstream line_stm(line);
00674     
00675     //proc_meminfo.getline(line_buf,sizeof(line_buf));
00676     //line_stm.seekg(0,ios_base::beg);
00677     //cout << line_stm;
00678     key="";
00679     val=0;
00680     units="";
00681     // MemTotal:      4059404 kB
00682     line_stm >> key;
00683     line_stm >> val;
00684     line_stm >> units;
00685 
00686     // Handle the linux-2.4 case.
00687     if (key=="total:") {
00688       std::string ignore;
00689       std::string line_mem;
00690       getline(proc_meminfo,line_mem);
00691       std::istringstream line_stm_24_mem(line_mem);
00692       line_stm_24_mem >> key;
00693       line_stm_24_mem >> total;       // total:
00694       line_stm_24_mem >> ignore;      // used:
00695       line_stm_24_mem >> free;        // free:
00696       line_stm_24_mem >> ignore;      // shared:
00697       line_stm_24_mem >> buffersUsed; // buffers:
00698       //
00699       std::string line_swap;
00700       getline(proc_meminfo,line_swap);
00701       std::istringstream line_stm_24_swap(line_swap);
00702       line_stm_24_swap >> ignore;      // Swap:
00703       line_stm_24_swap >> swapAvail;
00704       // we dont need any more data
00705       break;
00706     }
00707     //
00708     //printf("%-20s=%10lu %4s\n",key.c_str(),val,units.c_str());
00709     //
00710     if (units=="kB") {
00711       val=val*1024;
00712     } 
00713     else if (units=="MB") {
00714       val=val*1024*1024;
00715     } else {
00716       // just give up if the units arent there.
00717       break;
00718       // assert(0);
00719     }
00720     //
00721     if (key=="MemTotal:") {
00722       total=val;
00723     }
00724     else if (key=="MemFree:") {
00725       free=val;
00726     }
00727     else if (key=="SwapFree:") {
00728       swapAvail=val;
00729     }
00730     else if (key=="Buffers:") {
00731       buffersUsed=val;
00732     }
00733     else if (key=="Cached:") {
00734       cached=val;
00735     } 
00736   }
00737   proc_meminfo.close();
00738   
00739   memAvail=(uint64_t)(free+0.90*buffersUsed+cached);
00740   
00741   return true;
00742 }
00743 #endif
00744 
00745 #ifdef __APPLE__
00746 #define memInfo_defined 1
00753 bool memInfo_darwin(uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total,
00754                     uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail)
00755 {
00756   // ask mach 
00757   struct vm_statistics vm_stat;
00758   vm_size_t   my_pagesize;
00759   mach_port_t my_host=mach_host_self();
00760   mach_msg_type_number_t count = HOST_VM_INFO_COUNT;
00761   
00762   if (host_page_size(my_host,&my_pagesize)!=KERN_SUCCESS) {
00763     Err::errAbort("Util::memInfo() - Didnt succeed with 'host_page_size'.");
00764   }
00765   if (host_statistics(my_host, HOST_VM_INFO,(integer_t*)&vm_stat,&count) != KERN_SUCCESS) {
00766     Err::errAbort("Util::memInfo() - Didnt succeed with 'host_statistics'.");
00767   }
00768   
00769   // there isnt a total in the struct; sum it up.
00770   total=(vm_stat.free_count+vm_stat.active_count+vm_stat.inactive_count+vm_stat.wire_count);
00771   // THEN multiply by the page size.  (a 64b multiply)
00772   total=total*my_pagesize;
00773   
00774 //#define PRINT_IT(x) printf("%-30s: %8d\n",#x,x)
00775 //  PRINT_IT(vm_stat.free_count);
00776 //  PRINT_IT(vm_stat.active_count);
00777 //  PRINT_IT(vm_stat.inactive_count);
00778 //  PRINT_IT(vm_stat.wire_count);
00779 
00780   // should we add in vm_stat.inactive_count?
00781   free=vm_stat.free_count;
00782   free=free*my_pagesize;
00783   // darwin can use all the disk space -- report zero
00784   swapAvail=0;
00785   // our guess as to what we can allocate
00786   memAvail=(uint64_t)(0.90*(vm_stat.free_count+vm_stat.inactive_count)*my_pagesize);
00787   
00788   return true;
00789 }
00790 #endif
00791 
00792 #ifdef __sun__
00793 #define memInfo_defined 1
00800 bool memInfo_solaris(uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total,
00801                      uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail)
00802 {
00803   uint64_t page_size=sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE);
00804 
00805   free  =sysconf(_SC_AVPHYS_PAGES)*page_size;
00806   total =sysconf(_SC_PHYS_PAGES  )*page_size;
00807   // figure we can use a quarter of the allocated memory
00808   memAvail=free+((total-free)/4);
00809   // dont want to call swapctl...
00810   swapAvail=0;
00811 
00812   return true;
00813 }
00814 #endif
00815 
00816 #ifdef __which_system_was_this_for__
00817 #define memInfo_defined 1
00824 bool memInfo_sysinfo(uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total,
00825                      uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail)
00826 {
00827   struct sysinfo info;
00828   if(sysinfo(&info) != 0) {
00829     Err::errAbort("Util::memInfo() - Could not determine memory usage with: sysinfo().");
00830   }
00831   free = info.freeram * info.mem_unit;
00832   total = info.totalram * info.mem_unit;
00833   swapAvail = info.freeswap * info.mem_unit;
00834   // We use this as a guesstimate of how much ram we can safely allocate on the system.
00835   // The factor of 0.90 is to leave a bit of memory for other users.
00836   memAvail=(uint64_t)(free+0.90*(info.bufferram*info.mem_unit));
00837 
00838   return true;
00839 }
00840 #endif
00841 
00853 bool Util::memInfo(uint64_t &free, uint64_t &total, 
00854                    uint64_t &swapAvail, uint64_t& memAvail, 
00855                    bool cap32bit) {
00856   bool success = false;
00857   bool is32bit = false;
00858   free=total=swapAvail=memAvail=0;
00859 
00860   // One of these should be defined.
00861 #ifdef WIN32
00862   is32bit = true;
00863   success=memInfo_win32(free,total,swapAvail,memAvail);
00864 #endif
00865 #ifdef __linux__
00866   success=memInfo_linux("/proc/meminfo",free,total,swapAvail,memAvail);
00867 #endif
00868 #ifdef __APPLE__
00869   is32bit = true; // Until 10.5 OS X can't address big mem even on G5, what a bummer
00870   success=memInfo_darwin(free,total,swapAvail,memAvail);
00871 #endif
00872 #ifdef __sun__
00873   success=memInfo_solaris(free,total,swapAvail,memAvail);
00874 #endif
00875 #ifdef __i386__
00876   is32bit = true;
00877 #endif
00878 
00879   // The catch all clause
00880   //#ifndef memInfo_defined
00881   //#error memInfo is not defined for this platform
00882   //#endif
00883 
00884   //#ifdef __i386__ ||
00885   // we test for __i386__ as these systems cant map more than 2GB of space
00886   // even if they have more RAM in the system.
00887   if (memAvail>MEMINFO_2GB_MAX && is32bit && cap32bit) {
00888     memAvail=MEMINFO_2GB_MAX;
00889   }
00890   //#endif
00891 
00892   return success;
00893 }
00894 
00902 const char *Util::nextWhiteSpace(const char *s) {
00903   while(s[0] != '\0' && !isspace(s[0])) {
00904     s++;
00905   }
00906   return s;
00907 }
00908 
00919 void Util::printStringWidth(std::ostream &out, const char *str, int prefix,
00920                             int currentPos, int maxWidth ) {
00921   const char *wStart = NULL, *wEnd = NULL; /* Start and end of word pointers. */
00922   int position = currentPos;
00923   int nextSize = 0;
00924   int i = 0;
00925   wStart = str;
00926 
00927   /* While there are still characters to be printed. */
00928   while(*wStart != '\0') {
00929     
00930     /* Clean out any whitespace. */
00931     while(isspace(*wStart) && *wStart != '\0') {
00932       if(*wStart == '\n') {
00933         out.put('\n');
00934         for(i = 0; i < prefix; i++) 
00935           out.put(' ');
00936         fflush(stdout);
00937         position = prefix;
00938       }
00939       *wStart++;
00940     }
00941 
00942     if(*wStart == '\0')
00943       break;
00944 
00945     /* Find the end of current word. */
00946     wEnd = wStart;
00947     while(!isspace(*wEnd) && *wEnd != '\0')
00948       wEnd++;
00949     
00950     /* Time for a newline? */
00951     if((wEnd - wStart) + position >= maxWidth) {
00952       out.put('\n');
00953       for(i = 0; i < prefix; i++) 
00954         out.put(' ');      
00955       position = prefix;
00956     }
00957     
00958     /* Print out the word. */
00959     while(wStart < wEnd) {
00960       out.put(*wStart);
00961       fflush(stdout);
00962       wStart++;
00963       position++;
00964     }
00965 
00966     /* Look to see where next word is. */
00967     while(isspace(*wEnd)) {
00968       if(*wEnd == '\n') {
00969         out.put('\n');
00970         for(i = 0; i < prefix; i++) 
00971           out.put(' ');      
00972         position = prefix;
00973       }
00974       wEnd++;
00975     }
00976      
00977     /* Figure out the size of the next word. */
00978     wStart = nextWhiteSpace(wEnd);
00979     if(wStart != NULL)
00980       nextSize = wStart - wEnd;
00981     else
00982       nextSize = 0;
00983 
00984     /* Print a space if we're not going to 
00985        print a newline. */
00986     if(wEnd != '\0' &&
00987        nextSize + position < maxWidth && 
00988        position != 0) {
00989       out.put(' ');
00990       position++;
00991     }
00992 
00993     wStart = wEnd;
00994   }
00995 }
00996 
01002 bool Util::isFinite(double x) {
01003   bool isOk = false;
01004 #ifdef WIN32
01005   isOk = _finite(x);
01006 #else
01007   isOk = finite(x);
01008 #endif 
01009   return isOk;
01010 }
01011 
01012 std::string Util::getTimeStamp() 
01013 {
01014   char *timeStr = NULL;
01015   struct tm *tp;
01016   time_t t = time(NULL);
01017   tp = localtime(&t);
01018   timeStr = asctime(tp); // timestamp prefix for log entries
01019   if(timeStr == NULL) {
01020     timeStr = "unknown";
01021   } else if(strlen(timeStr) < 24) {
01022     timeStr[strlen(timeStr) - 1] = '\0'; // knock off trailing '\n'
01023   } else {
01024     // we knock of to a fixed size as we've seen
01025     // trailing garbage if using strlen() suggesting
01026     // that there are times when the null term is not
01027     // where we expect it.
01028     timeStr[24] = '\0'; // knock off trailing '\n'
01029   }
01030   std::string timess = timeStr;
01031   return timess;
01032 }
